div.p: From Morton Allport to William Spicer
Letter press copy book, pp. 18-19, Allport Library and Museum of Fine Arts, State Library of Tasmania, Hobart.

I am certain that the very name of Mueller's Book
Probably the intended Victorian school flora that was aborted after printing had commenced (see Lucas et al. (2006). would destroy its use for the purpose that will render yours valuable. It is especially for amateurs it is required and not for schools as the demand for the latter would at present be [infinitesimal] — Does the Baron really believe that he can induce any two men who choose to form their own opinions to assign the same limits to Genera, Species and Varieties? and this very difficulty is the strongest argument to my mind that all our systems of names still are but convenient arrangements to aid memory and the more such systems show the actual analogies the simpler and better they might be.

The Baron's illustration of Homo Sapiens
reference?
is I think an unhappy one as (whether derived from one source or not) I hold the Australian & the Caucasian to be distinct species as widely separated as Dog & Wolf —
I have no doubt the lithographs can be managed here very cheaply but the better way will be to get a specimen print or two first for which you & I might risk £ 5.00
